required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of PCO2 and PO2 Values in the Pulmonary Artery and Superior Vena Cava
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of PCO2 and PO2 Values in the Pulmonary Artery and in the Superior Vena Cava: Relationship With Cardiac Output, Hematocrit and Post Operative Organ Dysfunction

lead_sponsor.agency: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

clinical_study.source: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is about comparing blood samples obtained from the superior vena cava and the pulmonary artery. The investigators will compare the values of PCO2 and PO2 from these two sites, in order to see if exists a PCO2 gap and a PO2 gap, different from zero. Moreover the investigators want to find out if these gaps are related with changes in the cardiac output, the hematocrit or if they can predict post operative dysfunctions.
Blood samples will be taken at six different times as scheduled by the protocol. Along with the two venous blood samples, an arterial blood sample will be taken too, from a radial of femoral artery catheter.

primary_outcome.description: See if exists a PCO2 pa-svc gap different from zero in patients undergoing cardiac surgery
See if exists a PCO2 pa-svc gap different from zero in patients undergoing cardiac surgery

intervention.description: blood samples will be obtained from the superior vena cava (via centra venous catheter), from the pulmonary artery (via Swan Ganz catheter), and from a radial or femoral artery catheter

study_pop.textblock: Will be enrolled adult patients only , eligible for cardiac surgery (CABG, valvular replacement, aortic surgery) with extra corporeal circulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years
- patient undergoing cardiac surgery with extracorporeal circulation
- hemodynamic monitoring with a central venous catheter and a Swan Ganz catheter placed in the internal left giugulare vein
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe tricuspid insufficiency
- EF < 50%
- SOFA score >1 in at least one of all the criteria

facility.name: catholic University of the sacred Heart

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart
